content.raw: Since this pull request has been merged, I've created issue #399 to address the command mismatch.
content.html: Since this pull request has been merged, I've created issue #399 to address the command mismatch.

content.raw: I've been playing with the iRobot hands in Gazebo, and have noticed that the ROS commands don't match the actual iRobot hands. From the real iRobot hands documetation (and experiment): For posititons 1-4: 3500 to put finger approx 90 degrees, 6000 to close gently, 7000 to close finger tightly. For spread (5th position) 8.533 ticks per degree: 768 is 90 degree T grip, 512 rotates the fingers 60 degrees for a spherical grasp. The ROS commands for running the Gazebo iRobot hands are much larger by at least an order of magnitude.
content.html: I've been playing with the iRobot hands in Gazebo, and have noticed that the ROS commands don't match the actual iRobot hands. From the real iRobot hands documetation (and experiment): For posititons 1-4: 3500 to put finger approx 90 degrees, 6000 to close gently, 7000 to close finger tightly. For spread (5th position) 8.533 ticks per degree: 768 is 90 degree T grip, 512 rotates the fingers 60 degrees for a spherical grasp. The ROS commands for running the Gazebo iRobot hands are much larger by at least an order of magnitude.

`handle_msgs::HandleSensors` message is initialized to zero for now.

content.raw:
I did finally get it to work today. Thanks for the hints. The install steps aren't quite complete from what I needed to do, but the install gazebo-nightly helped. I did end up uninstalling just everything and starting from scratch (gazebo-nightly, sdformat, groovy, and drcsim. I had to install sdformat as well and follow more of the instructions for installing drcsim from [http://gazebosim.org/wiki/DRC/Install](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/DRC/Install), not including the line 
```
#!c++
 ros-groovy-pr2-controllers                  \
```
Additional instructions not included above or in the drcsim install page is probably obvious, but for more completeness remember the following after cloning drcsim:
```
#!c++
hg clone #!/osrf/drcsim
cd drcsim
hg pull && hg update update_irobot_hand
cd ..
```
content.html:
I did finally get it to work today. Thanks for the hints. The install steps aren't quite complete from what I needed to do, but the install gazebo-nightly helped. I did end up uninstalling just everything and starting from scratch (gazebo-nightly, sdformat, groovy, and drcsim. I had to install sdformat as well and follow more of the instructions for installing drcsim from http://gazebosim.org/wiki/DRC/Install, not including the line 

 ros-groovy-pr2-controllers                  \

Additional instructions not included above or in the drcsim install page is probably obvious, but for more completeness remember the following after cloning drcsim:

hg clone https://bitbucket.org/osrf/drcsim
cd drcsim
hg pull && hg update update_irobot_hand
cd ..

content.raw:
I just tested it, run fine in my precise + groovy system. Steps (not fully tested while written so they could need fixes):

```
apt-get update
apt-get install gazebo-nightly
mkdir -p ws/src
cd ws/src
hg clone #!/osrf/osrf-common
hg clone #!/osrf/sandia-hand
hg clone #!/osrf/drcsim
git clone https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs
cd ..
catkin_make -j5 install
. install/setup.bash
. install/share/drcsim/setup.sh 
```
content.html:
I just tested it, run fine in my precise + groovy system. Steps (not fully tested while written so they could need fixes):

apt-get update
apt-get install gazebo-nightly
mkdir -p ws/src
cd ws/src
hg clone #!/osrf/osrf-common
hg clone #!/osrf/sandia-hand
hg clone #!/osrf/drcsim
git clone https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs
cd ..
catkin_make -j5 install
. install/setup.bash
. install/share/drcsim/setup.sh

content.raw: If this functionality will require a new release of sdformat anyway, we could reduce some of the deprecation warnings by changing the `<cfmDaming>` tags to `<implicitSpringDamper>`. I did this in 9b0cda6 (branch update_irobot_hand_scpeters) if you're in the mood for merging it in.
content.html: If this functionality will require a new release of sdformat anyway, we could reduce some of the deprecation warnings by changing the <cfmDaming> tags to <implicitSpringDamper>. I did this in 9b0cda6 (branch update_irobot_hand_scpeters) if you're in the mood for merging it in.

content.raw: issue #139

content.raw:
The current plugin subscribes to [handle_msgs/HandleControl.msg](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/51d4095ddcdafe8e837e475c937e56d438521f46/handle_msgs/msg/HandleControl.msg?at=update_irobot_hand), you can trigger an action by:

~~~
rostopic pub -1 /left_hand/control handle_msgs/HandleControl '{type: [ 2, 2, 2, 2, 2 ] , value: [ 38000, 38000, 45000, 2000, 1500 ]}'
~~~

Above will try to control joint positions:
![hand position control](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/lgeewrkvl8hybvd/Screenshot%20from%202013-10-23%2019%3A08%3A23.png?dl=1)
content.html:
The current plugin subscribes to handle_msgs/HandleControl.msg, you can trigger an action by:

rostopic pub -1 /left_hand/control handle_msgs/HandleControl '{type: [ 2, 2, 2, 2, 2 ] , value: [ 38000, 38000, 45000, 2000, 1500 ]}'

Above will try to control joint positions:

This is tricky to test since it needs both [gazebo pull request #735](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/735/create-spring-damper-in-joints-issue-845/diff) and [gazebo pull request #737](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/737/add-ode-gearbox/diff) built from source and sdformat built from source. I successfully roslaunched atlas_v3_irobot_hands, and when I viewed the robot in rviz, the fingers don't show up.

content.html:
This is tricky to test since it needs both gazebo pull request #735 and gazebo pull request #737 built from source and sdformat built from source. I'll attach some instructions for how I built it with catkin.

I successfully roslaunched atlas_v3_irobot_hands, and when I viewed the robot in rviz, the fingers don't show up.
